ratings.rComments: Exams are difficult, I have gone to him for help and he was pretty rude and not helpful at all.

Interesting material and just study hard! Read through all the lecture slides! MCB is a lot of memorization. No point in complaining about how hard an exam is when you  are still responsible for the information for the exam,just put in the effort to study.
Great professor! Makes MCB interesting & I love how he gave alot of fun information about the topics we were learning. Exams are very fair!

Chapman's clearly invested in his studies but he's not made to be a lecturer. I never really paid attention so you CAN get by without going to class but be sure to memorize the slides. Exams are tough so study hard. Make sure you know the bacteria/fungi/protozoa for the final! This class is a bore but as long as you put in the effort you'll be fine

He doesn't know how to explain anything and goes off on too many tangents. So frustrating. Basically have to teach myself everything with help from good ol Google and the textbook. Literally, that class is just him reading off his powerpoints. Unbelievable. I'd be lucky to get a C by the end of this semester.
The homework is tedious busy work with 6 parts to one question and the exams are a collection of the most random questions that could possibly be asked
Disliked this class with  passion he is boring and can't explain what he's trying to teach to save his life. Even made me consider switching my MAJOR!

Chapman is a great guy and he is passionate about teaching, he's just not good at it. He is a terrible professor! 75% of your grade is based on exams. He rants on during lecture and does not know how to explain anything he teaches. Highly recommend not taking this class.

One class taught by Professor Chapman should be required for every student at U of I (and every other university). Yes his lecturing is a bit ridiculous, but he absolutely loves his job and that is what everyone should be required to see. Other than that, his tests are hard, get over it. He is also hilarious! Just give him a listen!
Nice guy, just a lot of studying from the powerpoints. never went to class just crammed a week before hand wasnt the worst as long as you knew the powerpoints well. got a B-

Professor Chapman is awful.  He is not clear with what to study for exams which are nearly impossible.  It is an absolute shame that such a prestigious school has this horrible of a professor.  His goal is to make a 100 level class so difficult and stressful.  Good luck to those that have to take it.  My advice: Take it somewhere else.  Seriously.

I have never written one of these but felt I needed to after taking this course.  Professor Chapman is the worst professor I've ever had.  He rambles on in lecture & is not very helpful when it comes to asking questions.  Avoid this class at all costs.  The only thing good is E.C., which can only go so far.  He should not be a professor at U of I.

In his spare time Kenneth enjoys sharing dark stories about Bubonic Plague victims, laughing about Bubonic Plague victims, long walks on the beach, and aiding his students in the act of cheating on yahoo answers. P.s. Ask him to bring his son to class (a picture will do) since according to genetics he will be a attractive specimen. Power to Kenneth

Kenneth changed my life. From the moment I walked into MCB 100, I knew I would never be the same. His stories are captivating, enticing, and can, at times, be very dark. (Ask about Joe and the Mountain Lion.) His southern accent soothes the soul and is what drags out of bed in the morning. Kenneth is a man of much knowledge. I highly recommend him.

I never rate teachers, but decided to for this one because I feel everyone should be warned: Chapman digresses in lecture. His slides also ramble and do not help you on exams. You never know when to study the book or the slides. If you study both, the amount of information is overwhelming. He is a terrible professor. He isn't effective at teaching.

I am an engineering student and have taken many difficult math, chemistry, and physics courses throughout my college career. However, although these classes were extremely difficult non have matched to how ridiculous Dr. Chapman class is. He makes the class much harder than it needs to be and is just god awful at lecturing. If you can avoid class

Dr. Chapman is one professor you will want to avoid. He rambles on in class and does not narrow down the material you need to know. If you don't read the text book, the class will be a major challenge since he is not a great teacher in lecture. When the class average on tests is a 61%, he's doing something wrong. The only plus is Extra Credit.
DON't take this class and the slides will not help you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I LOVE Professor Chapman! He is such a sweet man that wants us to do well.. his slides and study guides are not enough on their own, and for a 100 level class it's not super easy, but he gives a lot if you're open to learning. You definitely need to keep up on readings though. However this is college so that's obvious. Not an easyclass but greatguy
AVOID THIS CLASS!! It is extremely difficult. He rambles about nothing during every class period and you pretty much have to memorize the textbook in order to do well on exams.

I hated this class. His lectures were so boring and it was hard to pay attention. All of his exams are based on memorizing the slides and all of the slides are online, but he insists on making it the hardest 100 level class on campus.

he rambles on so much about stuff that will not be on the exam. you don't even really need to go to class but you have to study a ton outside of the class...definitely not an easy class. he does give some extra credit though and will answer any question you have

I have no idea why so many people say this class is easy.  Exams are really difficult to take and to study for.  If you aren't a good exam taker, you are screwed because that's 75% of the points.  Lectures are pretty boring, although the professor is informative.  I've made it through organic chemistry...and this class may be my first F.

This professor was not a very good teacher. I'm retaking this class at another institution with a more experienced teacher and he makes learning easier. My class isn't easier, but Dr. Chapman made microbiology way harder than it needed to be. I couldn't learn/retain anything. AND I studied a lot. Things changed a lot more the Fall of 2011.

he is willing to help every student who ask him a question. exams are easy as long as you study the practice exams well. homeworks are a little bit hard, but overall the class is easy with a nice prof

Definitely not the easiest science course. He changed things this semester. 3 exams including final; none dropped. Grades are based solely on that and hw. Exams = straight-forward but require a lot of memorization unless you love MCB so much that you just know everything by heart. He does give EC. He's a nice man, but does ramble a lot.
Easiest science course

These comments do not reflect the course at all. This is a college level course, not high school. Yes, you have to study to do well, but the exams are all objective. He gives plenty of extra credit after every exam and if you bother going to lecture, he's a kind, sweet man who cares about those who truly are here to learn. Excellent intro course!

Honestly this class is not as hard as people make it out to be. Lecture is not mandatory, though Dr.Chapman's odd humor and random tangents are pretty funny. He's a goofy little man. I recommend this class, but will caution that you actually have to study for the exams; considering you're in college, I would hope you can handle that...
Tends to go on random tangents, but can be entertaining at times

A great professor who always cares and helps students(though his humor is weird). His leture is not mandatory. He provides leture notes for every lecture and allows you to get those you don't have. Homework is minimal and you can get help online easily. So much extra credit opportunities. 4 tests with lowest score dropped makes the final optional.
Pay attention to little details.  Boring lecturer, exams were difficult and did not cover class material well.  Need to study to do well.

this class is so ridiculous. it is like my life right now. I'm not that bad at bio but this class is impossible. I study 24/7 and work my butt off to get Cs and Ds on the tests. Nursing majors: TAKE THIS CLASS SOMEWHERE ELSE!
This is definitely not the easiest class - to be successful in this class you need to read the book. Chapman only reads off his slides from lecture, so any outside help is a plus.
If you are not a good test taker, don't take this class. 75% of your grade is based on the exams alone!! Lectures are boring. There is too much to learn. Deffinatly not an easy A!!

Easy if you study the slides. He hosts review sessions the night before tests, but never mentioned them in lecture, so, you have to e-mail him to find out where they're located. NEVER used the book. All LONCAPA assignment answers can be found on Wikipedia. No need to go to lecture because all he really does is read off the slideshow that's online!
It's a pretty easy A if you study ahead. Gives help to whoever wants it but he is just a boring man. Doesn't make the class intersting at all. If you don't have to take his class then don't.
DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS.
It's been stated before, but this class is really easy. You don't even really have to go to the lectures and while he isn't the most fascinating guy, his little quirks and jokes make me giggle.
Easy A.... if you memorize all the stuff in the packets... no need to go to class just pull an all nighter the night before the test and you will get A's on tests
likes to go on tangents, but is amusing. class is a breeze for anyone with a decent bio or chem background. tests can get specific, but practice exams are usually rewordings of actual questions.

Gets off track a lot. No need to go to class because all of the lectures are online. His tests can get a bit specific and he goes off on tangents during class....just tune him out if you go. Very nerdy with cheap jokes.
He's a totally nice guy to talk to- about microbiology or anything else. He's not always the most focuesed person in the world, but he does explain things decently well.
I don't know what you're talking about "no respect for the student or himself".  The guy is AWESOME, his final is optional.  He's super nice and a fair grader
No respect for the student or himself. The friday classes were a failure.
No Comments
So adorable and the nicest guy ever.
